page.title: 20CONSERVATION AREA, CLYRO
page.content: In order to protect the buildings and form of our national heritage the ancient core of Clyro was designated a {"Conservation Area"}in 1983. It was important to preserve a typical example of a{Welsh Border Village}of the Wye Valley and its progression from ancient times to the present day. Some of the open spaces are included e.g.{"The Orchard,"}cider apple and pear trees of venerable size and age. Earliest buildings are a{Mediaeval {Gateway}at Clyro Court Farm and { {"Sacred Cottage"}(priest's house). Fine groups of Welsh stone cottages (16th - 18th century), village shop, cottage once Police Station and Post Office, Baskerville Arms, Mid-Victorian cottages and Kilvert's lodgings, surround church and graveyard.{Clyro Court, Caemawr and {Old Vicarage}are of the 19th century.
